text: I'd like to say for the record that I
hate energy-saving lightbulbs LED light
bulbs are fantastic all LED lights are
great they don't use much electricity
that brilliant in torches and they're
going to be very good on cars and bikes
and bicycles and so on but the energy
the fluorescent energy-saving ones that
look like a series are sort of bendy
tubes they're rubbish because you put
them in the bedside light and you think
I'll get into bed and I'll read my book
for a bit you turn it on and you just
get this sort of faintly yellow urinary
glow for what seems like about
three-quarters of an hour before it's
actually bright enough to read your
pudding by then you've fallen asleep so
actually they're causing me to be less
well informed I read less in bed than I
used to because I can't wait for the
light to warm up and I could if you said
that to someone who had to read by
candlelight never sconce or by you know
lighting a little gas burner or
something they'd say oh don't be so
ridiculous but you know things that are
slow in the modern world are annoying an
internet connection that takes three
seconds to work is infuriating so a
light bulb that takes three minutes to
become bright is unacceptable get rid of
them well the light bulb as an invention
is brilliant actually
it's although in itself the light bulb
was a almost a standalone invention we
did have light before that because apart
from obviously gas lights and blazing
torches held by Romans and so on we did
have things like electric art lighting
but that couldn't really be used in the
home it was too complicated and too
expensive and actually consumed a vast
amount of electricity and so the
lightbulb the idea that you could simply
press a switch assuming you've developed
the idea of mains electricity obviously
we press the switch and the place is lit
up must have made a massive difference
to the world because prior to that you'd
have fiddly gas lighting which wasn't
very bright and burned your house down
and prior to that candles which is why I
think the Victorians had so many ghost
stories very occasionally when there is
a power cut you go into especially an
old building that doesn't have
particularly big windows you walk around
with a candle
if you haven't got a torch and there
could be somebody standing an arm's
length away or so and you wouldn't know
they were there so have stories of
murderers spirits and the Restless dead
and Jacob Marley walking the earth with
chains and all that I can see how that
grew up in an era with no easily made
artificial light so light bulbs are yeah
cool except they're hot obviously what
subject of changing light bulbs yes I'm
quite handy around here so I'm a
reasonably practical man I have a number
of practical dreary qualifications I
think it's to feel about changing light
bulbs around the house I've even had a
discussion about this on Twitter
nobody's come up with a very good
solution apart from leaving a note but
is the problem is for example recently
the the what I still call the big light
that line hanging from the ceiling in my
bedroom broke and my other half said to
me she said Oh change the light bulb but
you'll have to change the light bulb
tomorrow it is broke and I said yeah but
of course in the daylight you forget
because you don't turn it on because
it's not dark and then by the time it
gets to night you press the switch you
think oh no the light bulbs broken I
can't change it cuz dark I can't see so
how do you we need we need a mechanism
whereby there's half an hour of
selective darkness in the middle of the
day to remind you to change broken light
bulbs before it gets to night time or
write it on a piece of paper and stick
it on the door but you didn't do that
deal when it's time to get it bending
the other light bulbs bro I'll amend it
in the morning but you don't it's
actually four months since it broke and
I still haven't remembered to change it
during the day
